abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Croatia Court and
            Bankruptcy Administration Project  were as follows: outcomes
            for the first project were moderately satisfactory, the risk
            to development outcome was low or negligible, the Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was moderately satsifactory. Some lessons
            learned included: 1) there may well be an inherent
            contradiction between the exploratory nature of the learning
            and innovation (LIL) instrument and the intended short
            implementation time table; 2) as a project that coalesced
            around information and information systems, the project
            demonstrated the interplay between reform and information --
            specifically, the strong reform intent of the original
            design was somewhat downplayed; and 3) the iterative pattern
            of reform and information systems development is likely to
            manifest in a wide range of settings, not confined to the
            judicial sector.
